paper_abstract: It is proved that an optimal {epsilon, 1}(n) solution to a "epsilon-perturbed" discrete minimum weight problem with constraints on compliance, von Mises stresses and strain energy densities, is optimal, after rounding to {0, 1}(n), to the corresponding "unperturbed" discrete problem, provided that the constraints in the perturbed problem are carefully defined and epsilon > 0 is sufficiently small.
paper_title: On the validity of using small positive lower bounds on design variables in discrete topology optimization
